title: The Parable of the Dom and the Farmer
subtitle: Imperfect and not a final version
author: Aleksandr
summary: A teaching parable comparing the long, steady work of recovery to a farmer cultivating new ground. It outlines the stages of breaking hardened earth, sowing with patience, waiting through silent seasons, guarding fragile new growth, and learning to endure storms without despair. The parable affirms that healing is slow, cyclical, and possible in every season, and that the seeds planted in truth always remember how to grow.

motifMap.meaning: Admitting need; breaking ground hardened by suffering.
Small acts of effort that only bear fruit with time.
Delicate early healing that must be guarded.
Setbacks or relapse; external and internal forces that test growth.

associatedMedia.description: Full text of 'The Parable of the Dom and the Farmer' on Substack.
